skill.name: datamol
skill.description: Pythonic wrapper around RDKit with simplified interface and sensible defaults. Preferred for standard drug discovery: SMILES parsing, standardization, descriptors, fingerprints, clustering, 3D conformers, parallel processing. Returns native rdkit.Chem.Mol objects. For advanced control or custom parameters, use rdkit directly.
skill.summary: Pythonic wrapper around RDKit with simplified interface and sensible defaults. Preferred for standar...
skill.author: davila7

security_audit.summary: This skill is documentation-only, containing markdown files with Python code examples for the Datamol cheminformatics library. All 521 static findings are false positives caused by the scanner misinterpreting chemistry terminology and markdown code fences as security threats. No executable code, scripts, or malicious patterns exist.

content.user_title: Analyze molecules and compute drug properties with Python
content.value_statement: Working with molecular data in Python requires complex RDKit code. Datamol provides simple functions for SMILES parsing, property calculation, and compound analysis.
actual_capabilities: Parse and convert molecular formats including SMILES, InChI, and SELFIES
Calculate molecular descriptors like molecular weight, LogP, and hydrogen bond counts
Compute molecular fingerprints and similarity scores
Extract Murcko scaffolds and fragment molecules with BRICS or RECAP
Read and write molecular files in SDF, CSV, and Excel formats
limitations: Requires datamol and rdkit Python libraries to be installed
Butina clustering limited to approximately 1000 molecules due to memory constraints
3D conformer generation can be slow for large molecules
Some advanced RDKit features require direct RDKit API access

use_cases.title: Filter compounds by drug-likeness rules
use_cases.description: Apply Lipinski Rule of Five filters to compound libraries by calculating molecular weight, LogP, and hydrogen bond donors and acceptors.

use_cases.title: Build molecular features for ML models
use_cases.description: Generate molecular fingerprints and compute descriptor tables for training machine learning models on chemical datasets.

use_cases.title: Analyze SAR by scaffold clustering
use_cases.description: Group compounds by Murcko scaffolds, visualize structural series, and identify activity patterns across chemical series.

prompt_templates.title: Parse SMILES string
prompt_templates.scenario: Convert a SMILES string to a molecule object
prompt_templates.prompt: Use datamol to parse this SMILES string and standardize it: CCO

prompt_templates.title: Calculate descriptors
prompt_templates.scenario: Compute drug-like properties for a molecule
prompt_templates.prompt: Calculate molecular weight, LogP, and hydrogen bond counts for this compound using datamol: c1ccc(CC(=O)O)cc1

prompt_templates.title: Cluster by similarity
prompt_templates.scenario: Group similar molecules from a compound list
prompt_templates.prompt: Use datamol to cluster these SMILES by structural similarity with a Tanimoto cutoff of 0.3: [list of SMILES]

prompt_templates.title: Generate conformers
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate 20 low-energy 3D conformers for this molecule using datamol ETKDGv3 method: c1ccccc1CCO

output: Passes Lipinski Rule of Five: Yes

best_practices: Always standardize molecules from external sources using dm.standardize_mol before analysis
Check for None values after parsing SMILES strings since invalid molecules return None
Use n_jobs=-1 parameter for parallel processing when working with large compound sets
anti_patterns: Do not use Butina clustering for datasets larger than 1000 molecules due to memory limits
Do not skip molecule sanitization when loading data from untrusted sources
Do not generate excessive conformers for large molecules as this causes slow performance

faq.question: What is the difference between datamol and RDKit?
faq.answer: Datamol is a wrapper around RDKit that provides simpler function calls and sensible defaults. All datamol molecules are native RDKit Mol objects.

faq.question: How do I install datamol?
faq.answer: Run 'uv pip install datamol' or 'pip install datamol'. RDKit is installed automatically as a dependency.

faq.question: Can datamol read files from cloud storage?
faq.answer: Yes, datamol uses fsspec for file I/O. You can read from S3, GCS, or HTTP URLs directly by passing the URL to read functions.

faq.question: What fingerprint type should I use for similarity searches?
faq.answer: ECFP (Extended Connectivity Fingerprints) with radius 2 is the default and works well for general structural similarity.

faq.question: How do I filter compounds by Lipinski Rule of Five?
faq.answer: Use dm.descriptors.compute_many_descriptors to get mw, logp, hbd, and hba values, then filter by the standard thresholds.

faq.question: Why does my clustering run out of memory?
faq.answer: Butina clustering builds a full distance matrix. Use dm.pick_diverse for datasets over 1000 molecules instead.
